content.question: Based on Figure 1, which of the following best compares the atomic structures of starch and cellulose?

choices.label: Starch is composed of carbon, hydrogen, and oxygen, while cellulose also contains nitrogen.
Starch and cellulose are composed of repeating glucose monomers; however, in cellulose every other glucose monomer is rotated 180 degrees.

Starch is composed of monomers that each have a <math alttext="C H 2 O H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>OH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> group, while cellulose only has a <math alttext="C H 2 O H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>OH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> group on every other monomer.
Starch and cellulose are composed of identical monomers and therefore have identical structures.

content.answer: Starch and cellulose are composed of repeating glucose monomers; however, in cellulose every other glucose monomer is rotated 180 degrees.

skill.text: 2.A: Describe characteristics of visual representations of biological concepts and processes.
